text: <@U3HJVAXST|anandkarwa> has joined the channel

Hey everyone I am trying out the basic fabric setup from the official document and trying to deploy chaincode example 2. I am facing  some error while performing query transaction which says "Chaincode handler FSM cannot handle message (RANGE_QUERY_STATE) with payload size (10) while in state: ready"
Did anyone of you have faced and resloved the issue? I have also posted it over stackoverflow ( <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41220806/unable-to-query-on-chaincode-example-2> )

attachments.title: Unable to query on chaincode example 2
attachments.text: I am trying to setup the blockchain as described on the official documents.Officail document linkDeploy and Invoke for blockchain seems to work fine. But whenever I perform query it fails and
attachments.fallback: Unable to query on chaincode example 2

text: <@U3HJVAXST> never had the problem. just curious which Option (1,2,3) did you follow?
<@U2ZNC3PKN>  option 2
<@U3HJVAXST> Mac or Windows?
<@U2ZNC3PKN>  I am doing it over centos have installed docker on it

<@U3HJVAXST> well the last time I tried that, I use ubuntu14.04 and had no problem with query.
It can only run with dev mode only as I remember (but that's another problem I guess)
<@U3HJVAXST> according to the link to that manual, your are using peer CLI to deploy/invoke/query the chaincode?
I tried it with both peer CLI as well as REST api both gives the same error
I am Loging into vp0_1 docker container and executing those peer CLI queries from peer folder
vp0_1? According to the hard to follow doc, it only configured with "membersrvc" and "vp0".
when I do docker ps it shows me 2 docker containers "githubcom_vp0_1" and "githubcom_membersrvc_1"
are you using docker-compose with the yaml file on the linked documentation?
ah sorry, never mind. that yaml file doesn't set container name.
and you also run the chaincode on the vp0_1?

just to make sure, is the chaincode running when you deploy and invoke.
there's should be a log from the chaincode if you read the example02 source.
nope I have checkedout and build the chaincode on my host machine and executed it from same pointing out the CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:7051 while running it
is it necessary to run it in vp0_1 as well ?
<@U3HJVAXST> AFAIK nope, as long as their both can talk with gRPC (7051) that should be fine I guess

perhaps you should check your logs on peer, chaincode, and peer(cli) if there's any suspicious error when you execute the query.
if you were able to execute invoke, I'm not sure why you won't be able to run the query.
<@U3HJVAXST|anandkarwa> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/anandkarwa/F3H33S7BP/log_on_peer.txt|log on peer>

text:
<@U3HJVAXST> wait, you said you build the chaincode yourself ? could it be some version mismatch with the running peer?
try to build your chaincode inside vp0_1 and run it from there, the container should already have go and all the sources inside.
<@U2ZNC3PKN>  okay let me try that

<@U2ZNC3PKN>  it worked. I have used the example which was present inside the container as checking out new code was giving errors (Seems container has old fabric code while there are new changes in the latest example02)
Thanks for your help Sk :slightly_smiling_face: can you also reply on my stackoverflow question please :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U3HA37S67|alexjipark> has joined the channel
